Package mvc.controller

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Menus
    The Menus interface is used to help replace a long switch statement in the controller this is designed to be a helper system to the controller that handles user inputs for specific menus, i.e.
    StockController
    The StockController interface represents the handling of inputs to the stock program via the controller the StockController interface has two implementations that coexist, the Simple and Advanced controllers, the advanced controller class adds support for the new inputs while delegating any existing inputs to the simple controller.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractMenus
    The AbstractMenus class is an abstract class that houses common methods to all menus like prompting for the date, etc...
    AdvancedPortfolioMenu
    The AdvancedPortfolioMenu class extends the functionality of the SimplePortfolioMenu class to add support for the inputs that are need for the updated portfolio functionality.
    AdvancedStockController
    The AdvancedStockController class is the new controller that supports upgraded functionality over the SimpleStockController.
    GraphicsStockController
    The GraphicsStockController class is an implementation on the StockController interface that works for graphical user interfaces.
    SimplePortfolioMenu
    The SimplePortfolioMenu handles the inputs for the existing simple functions.
    SimpleStockController
    Controller class that processes user input this SimpleStockController is outdated because it doesn't support the new functions, but it is still used to handle any unchanged functionality and the inputs that are used for that.
    SimpleStockMenu
    The SimpleStockMenu support the inputs for basic stock functions like gain/loss, moving avg, crossovers.
